page.title: 13Entertainment in Jedburgh
page.content: A complaint often heard is that there is little entertainment.There is no cinema or theatre and seldom an opportunity to hear classical music.The travelling Northumberland Theatre Group do visit the Town Hall two or three times each year.The schools are visited by the County Trio, a group of musicians employed by the Region.The town has a British Legion Pipe Band and Jedforest Instrumental Silver Band which both perform in public.Accordian clubs also give concerts.The schools also entertain the public with music and drama.Various organisations also put on some form of entertainment to raise funds for charity.Discos are held fairly regularly in the Town Hall and many clubs also hold dances.During the Callant's Festival various forms of entertainment is provided.
